caption:
This photograph depicts a forest scene filled with recently-damaged or disrupted natural environment. The image perspective is looking down a sloping landscape strewn with scattered debris. The visible ground is littered with broken branches, leaves, and possibly remnants of metallic or synthetic materials, suggesting recent human activity or disaster might have occurred.

Trees, both standing and fallen, dominate the composition, indicative of a dense forest. The foliage is dark and appears wet, potentially due to rain or dew, giving a glistening effect under ambient light. The sky in the background envelops the scene in a slightly foggy, misty veil, creating an ethereal yet somewhat somber atmosphere.

The light filtering through the trees casts pockets of shadow and sun across the debris, enhancing the texture and depth of the scene. There is no visible fauna or human presence in the immediate foreground, emphasizing the aftermath of disruption in what appears to be a secluded natural area. The focus of the photograph draws attention to the contrast between the natural environment and the incongruous materials disrupted onto the forest floor.
title: Litter along a county road between Bremerton and seabeck increased land use pressure for areas like this is expected when the navy's trident submarine base is built nearby.  A "new city" is proposed to house a substantial portion of the projected 27,000 people who will move into the area when the naval installation is completed
